name: Infrared Sauna
description: Far-infrared (FIR) sauna panels that heat the body directly at lower ambient temperatures (40-65°C) compared to traditional Finnish saunas. Promotes detoxification, cardiovascular conditioning, and heat shock protein production with better tolerability.
mechanisms: Heavy metal and toxin excretion via sweat

dosage.notes: Lower temperature than Finnish sauna but longer sessions. Far-infrared penetrates 1.5 inches into tissue. Hydrate well. Mineral supplementation recommended.

keyFindings: Similar cardiovascular benefits to Finnish sauna at more tolerable temperatures
Improved symptoms in congestive heart failure patients (Waon therapy, Japan)
Enhanced detoxification — heavy metals and BPA found in sweat at higher concentrations than blood
